page.title: 01THE GATEHOUSE OF FLEET AREA
page.content: Gatehouse of Fleet is situated in S.W. Scotland. It is a very picturesque area indeed. Despite its size it has a rich and vivid industrial past. The main industries to emerge at that time were cotton spinning, breweries and brick-making. Its little harbour, Port McAdam, also thrived. The landowner then was James Murray who built the impressive Cally Palace (now an hotel), even to this there is a "feudal superior", Mrs. Murray-Usher - decendant of James Murray. Present day Gatehouse is a busy little town, surrounded by good farmland and forestry, it has several shops, inns and hotels. It is a popular stopping-off place for tourists and commercial drivers on the busy A75 "Euro-route" which runs through the town. A by-pass, however, is due to open in 1986, which will stop the
